placesToVisit.description: Witness the last remaining wonder of the ancient world, an iconic symbol of Egypt's rich history.
Immerse yourself in a vibrant, bustling bazaar, perfect for finding unique souvenirs and experiencing local culture.
Explore a vast collection of ancient artifacts, including the treasures of Tutankhamun.
Take a cable car to the top for breathtaking panoramic views of the city and surrounding coastline.
Visit the infamous prison where Nelson Mandela was held, a powerful reminder of South Africa's history.
Get up close with a colony of African penguins in a beautiful, sheltered cove.
Escape to a stunning botanical garden with vibrant blue accents, formerly owned by Yves Saint Laurent.
Experience the heart of the medina, a bustling square filled with storytellers, musicians, and food stalls.
Admire the intricate Islamic and Moroccan architecture in this stunning 19th-century palace.
Enjoy a unique safari experience with a backdrop of the city skyline, home to lions, rhinos, and giraffes.
Visit an orphan elephant rescue and rehabilitation center and see the baby elephants during their feeding time.
Feed and interact with endangered Rothschild's giraffes from a raised platform.
Walk on the longest canopy walkway in Africa and spot monkeys and other wildlife in this urban nature reserve.
Discover a stunning collection of Nigerian art, from traditional to contemporary, in a massive four-story gallery.
Relax on a sheltered, artificial beach that is popular with swimmers and water sports enthusiasts.
